title: Benedictare
author: Benedictare
content: With the poor state of electricity supply in our country and the high inflation of the economy, increase in PMS (fuel ) price,it has become very difficult to use generator, power bank another issue of its own even solar has also become more expensive for people to buy  or even pay in instalment.Livelihood is becoming more difficult by the day,no money to have your proper and adequate meal,no good job to maintain your standard of living and meet  your needs.I got introduced to Bitcoin and I have been trying to do my activities, but the condition of poor electricity supply Will  not permit me to easily do my Bitcoin activities in the forum .How do I find a way out of this epileptic power supply of the country, so that I can be consistent in the forum  performing  my activities .What do i do ? I seriously need your contributions and advice.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Use phone if you do not have enough money. Buy a power bank with it. If you do not really have light, get a second power bank so that you can charge the two at once when there is light. There are phone with 4000 to 5000 mAh battery that can last you almost a whole day with internet. If you can not get it new, get the second hand.

I seriously need your contributions and advice. Electricity has been one of the major problems that has hindered our economic growth in this country as due to poor or no electricity, many businesses has suffered setback more especially now that the petrol pump price has been increased thereby making it difficult for business owners that have generator.It is very funny to see how a country that has not experienced a stable power system will be supplying electricity to other countries like Ghana in compromise of her own country.However, there is always a way out of every challenge because as a result of negligence from our government in some vital sectors, it is advisable for one to take responsibility of one's needs in other to succeed. In as much as poor electricity  has been a lingering challenge over the years I think every individual needs to look for other ways of making sure that there business doesn't go backwards as a result of the fact that we don't have a stable power supply as in the aspect of how to charge your devices to continue your interaction in this community, I believe you can sort help to power your devices from a neighbor or business owners that uses generator to charge your devices

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Benedictare on October 16, 2023, 10:14:48 PMI got introduced to Bitcoin and I have been trying to do my activities, but the condition of poor electricity supply Will  not permit me to easily do my Bitcoin activities in the forum .How do I find a way out of this epileptic power supply of the country, so that I can be consistent in the forum  performing  my activities .What do i do ? I seriously need your contributions and advice. How you can get out of the epileptic power supply? I don't think anyone here can give you that answer since we're all suffering from the same plaque as you are and can only mitigate the issue through finding their own alternative. But na so we all they suffer from this lack of electricity o. And that's exactly how other MSMEs are also suffering from it. But like the MSMEs will look for alternatives, me and you too can. At least our activities require less power consumption unlike other businesses.So what I will encourage that you look for an alternative that can last you several times without Uninterrupted Power on your phone. For example, you can get a bigger Power Bank or add two extra to what you already have. There are also solar charger power banks available. You can get like two of that as a standard. So far as it is to charge your phone devices, that should suffice.Unfortunately, we live in a country where basic amenities have become luxury. Where comon electricity don turn to something else. Now we gaz go look for other options. But why won't it be like that. I remember during the senate interview of El-rufai for the ministerial position, he made mention of we having around 11 licensed DISCOS (Distribution Companies) of which it's only 3 that are functional. Then why won't their be wasted generated power whereas we are saying even the megawatts currently generated are not enough, yet we have enough being wasted due to lack of transmission and distribution.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP I understand your plight and the fact that you find it difficult engaging in activities here as a result of the epileptic power supply here in our country Nigeria. As a matter of fact, this has been a problem in Nigeria when it comes to electricity power supply. Nigeria is yet to tackle the issue of electricity let alone to have it constantly being supplied to the consumers or citizens. You can be able to work with your phone if you can as I believe there are no much task here on this platform  you can not be able to work out with your phone. When it comes to creating a thread, replying or post or comment even to the point of wearing a signature and avatar, that can be done with a phone although phone features are a bit limited but at most some engagement can be done with a phone. When it comes to electricity as it regards to your functions here, it should not be a thing of complaint to you because you should always improvise to sort things out. There are phone charging spots where you can go charge your phone for as little as #100 more or less.  At least you have a barbing shop where you go to barb your hair, barbers do not bother their customers when it comes to charging of phone but they can only tell you to watch after your phone as it is your sole responsibility to do so while charging it. You can explore other means of charging your device so as to help sustain your work as the case may be. You may as well consider relocating from that place if you see that the electricity situation there is not favourable to you.

There are people mining Bitcoin in Nigeria even on low key, there is no way such people will not need stable electricity. When power is made constant in Nigeria, a lot of businesses will boom including mining of Bitcoin. If it is other areas of Bitcoin generating businesses like the forum, trading and others, then a phone is fine for it. Beyond that, a laptop is definitely needed. It is well known that electricity is a primary need in a nation as it leads to economic growth and sustenance. With electricity, industries can function, business can thrive and other activities dependent on it will wax strong. Same is applicable to the Crypto and Bitcoin industry. It is true not every Bitcoin activities that can be done with a phone but for those that can be done with a phone and are beneficial to OP, I think it would be better for OP to look for a way out because what ever is your source of income must be taken seriously and as such OP should do the needful by looking for a means to power his or her phone if he or she means business. I have read other response from members and I think what they have said is what is obtainable and not negotiable if OP really appreciate his work. For the miners, before they think of erecting a mining farm, they already know the situation of things when it comes to electricity power supply so I believe they must have had an alternative means of power supply so that their business can strive because no reasonable person would depend on our electricity to power their mining farm.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Epileptic power supply na long-standing problem for our country, every administration wey come dey always promise Nigerians better power supply, but dem dey always fail in doing that. The situation is so bad that we as Nigerians are now inure to the pains of epileptic power supply, and we just find a way to manage the situation, and that's exactly wetin OP go do. Electricity is so important, so you have to power your house with your generator, you also have to buy more than one power bank and also prioritize devices that has a stronger battery life. If you cannot always buy fuel to use your generator, then you have to charge your devices in a friend's house or in public centers, this is exactly how an average Nigerian manages the situation.
